alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gilmer; Jackson; Mason; Putnam; Roane; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 2:28PM EDT until May 06 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Roane County in central West Virginia... Calhoun County in north central West Virginia... Gilmer County in north central West Virginia... Central Jackson County in northwestern West Virginia... Southeastern Wirt County in northwestern West Virginia... East Central Mason County in western West Virginia... North Central Putnam County in western West Virginia... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 228 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area with localized higher amounts. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ripley, Glenville, Grantsville, Arnoldsburg, Cedar Creek State Park, Reedy, Sand Fork, Annamoriah, Creston, Mount Zion, Millstone, Lucille, Orma, Big Springs, Stumptown, Normantown, Tanner, Leroy, Gay and Newberne. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Gilmer; Jackson; Mason; Putnam; Roane; Wirt
